verificationGuide.title: How to Verify This Evidence
verificationGuide.subtitle: This guide explains how to independently verify the evidence package without relying on our platform.
verificationGuide.section1Item1: Canonical Evidence: Video hash, frame hashes, creator ID, timestamps
verificationGuide.section1Item2: Merkle Proof: Cryptographic proof linking this evidence to a batch root
verificationGuide.section1Item3: Blockchain Anchor: Transaction hash, block number, network info
verificationGuide.section1Item4: Chain of Custody: Event log showing the certification timeline
verificationGuide.section1Item5: TSA Timestamp Token: RFC 3161 timestamp from trusted authority (if available)
verificationGuide.section2Step2Desc2: Remove any undefined/null fields that aren't in the canonical structure
verificationGuide.section2Note: Verify this hash matches the evidence_hash in the package.
verificationGuide.section3Step1: Start with your evidence hash as the current hash
verificationGuide.section3Step2: For each sibling in the proof path:
verificationGuide.section3Step2a: If index is even: hash = SHA256(current_hash + sibling)
verificationGuide.section3Step2b: If index is odd: hash = SHA256(sibling + current_hash)
verificationGuide.section3Step3: The final hash should match the Merkle root
verificationGuide.section4Step1Desc3: Verify the transaction exists and is confirmed
verificationGuide.section4Step2: Step 2: Extract Merkle root from transaction
verificationGuide.section4Step2Desc1: The Merkle root is stored in the transaction's input data field
verificationGuide.section4Step2Desc2: It's a 32-byte (64 hex character) value starting with 0x
verificationGuide.section4Step3Desc1: The root from the blockchain should match the root in your Merkle proof
verificationGuide.section4Step3Desc2: Block timestamp should be after the certification timestamp
verificationGuide.section5Desc: If the package includes a tsa_token, you can verify it using:
verificationGuide.section5Item2: Verify the timestamp authority's certificate chain
verificationGuide.section5Item3: Verify the token was issued before the block timestamp
verificationGuide.section5Note: Note: TSA verification requires the TSA's certificate. Contact us for certificate details.
verificationGuide.section6Desc: Each event log has a log_hash. Verify the chain:
verificationGuide.section6Item1: Event 1's hash should match Event 2's previous_log_hash
verificationGuide.section6Item2: Each log_hash should be SHA256(event_data + previous_log_hash)
verificationGuide.section6Item3: All events should be in chronological order
verificationGuide.resourcesItem1: Download the full evidence package to get all verification data
verificationGuide.resourcesItem3: For technical support, contact our engineering team
